verses.kjv: Now when Solomon had made an end of praying, the fire came down from heaven, and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices; and the glory of the LORD filled the house.
verses.ct: When Solomon finished praying, fire came down from heaven and burned up the burnt offering and the sacrifices, and the glory of the LORD filled the temple.

verses.kjv: And the priests could not enter into the house of the LORD, because the glory of the LORD had filled the LORD’s house.
verses.ct: The priests were unable to enter the LORD's temple because the glory of the LORD had filled it completely.

verses.kjv: And when all the children of Israel saw how the fire came down, and the glory of the LORD upon the house, they bowed themselves with their faces to the ground upon the pavement, and worshipped, and praised the LORD, saying, For he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.
verses.ct: When all the Israelites saw the fire come down and the glory of the LORD resting on the temple, they knelt with their faces to the stone pavement and worshiped, praising the LORD and saying, "He is good; his mercy lasts forever."

verses.kjv: Then the king and all the people offered sacrifices before the LORD.
verses.ct: Then the king and all the people presented sacrifices in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon offered a sacrifice of twenty and two thousand oxen, and an hundred and twenty thousand sheep: so the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.
verses.ct: King Solomon sacrificed 22,000 cattle and 120,000 sheep. In this way, the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.

verses.kjv: And the priests waited on their offices: the Levites also with instruments of musick of the LORD, which David the king had made to praise the LORD, because his mercy endureth for ever, when David praised by their ministry; and the priests sounded trumpets before them, and all Israel stood.
verses.ct: The priests stood at their assigned positions, and the Levites played the musical instruments of the LORD that King David had made for praising the LORD, because his mercy lasts forever. David had used these instruments in his worship. The priests blew trumpets opposite them, and all Israel stood.

verses.kjv: Moreover Solomon hallowed the middle of the court that was before the house of the LORD: for there he offered burnt offerings, and the fat of the peace offerings, because the brasen altar which Solomon had made was not able to receive the burnt offerings, and the meat offerings, and the fat.
verses.ct: Solomon also consecrated the center of the courtyard in front of the LORD's temple. There he presented the burnt offerings and the fat portions of the peace offerings, because the bronze altar Solomon had made could not hold all the burnt offerings, grain offerings, and fat portions.

verses.kjv: Also at the same time Solomon kept the feast seven days, and all Israel with him, a very great congregation, from the entering in of Hamath unto the river of Egypt.
verses.ct: At that same time, Solomon celebrated the festival for 7 days, along with all Israel — an enormous assembly of people from as far as Lebo-hamath to the river of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And in the eighth day they made a solemn assembly: for they kept the dedication of the altar seven days, and the feast seven days.
verses.ct: On the 8th day they held a sacred closing assembly, since they had spent 7 days dedicating the altar and 7 days celebrating the festival.

verses.kjv: And on the three and twentieth day of the seventh month he sent the people away into their tents, glad and merry in heart for the goodness that the LORD had shewed unto David, and to Solomon, and to Israel his people.
verses.ct: On the 23rd day of the 7th month, Solomon sent the people home to their tents. They were joyful and happy because of all the good things the LORD had done for David, for Solomon, and for his people Israel.

verses.kjv: Thus Solomon finished the house of the LORD, and the king’s house: and all that came into Solomon’s heart to make in the house of the LORD, and in his own house, he prosperously effected.
verses.ct: So Solomon completed the LORD's temple and the royal palace. Everything Solomon had planned to accomplish in the LORD's temple and in his own palace, he successfully carried out.

verses.kjv: And the LORD appeared to Solomon by night, and said unto him, I have heard thy prayer, and have chosen this place to myself for an house of sacrifice.
verses.ct: Then the LORD appeared to Solomon at night and told him, "I have heard your prayer and have chosen this place for myself as a temple of sacrifice."

verses.kjv: If I shut up heaven that there be no rain, or if I command the locusts to devour the land, or if I send pestilence among my people;
verses.ct: "When I close up the heavens so that no rain falls, or when I command locusts to consume the land, or when I send a plague among my people —"

verses.kjv: If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.
verses.ct: "if my people, who are called by my name, humble themselves, pray, seek my presence, and turn away from their wicked behavior, then I will listen from heaven, forgive their sin, and restore their land."

verses.kjv: Now mine eyes shall be open, and mine ears attent unto the prayer that is made in this place.
verses.ct: "From now on, my eyes will be open and my ears will be attentive to every prayer offered in this place."

verses.kjv: For now have I chosen and sanctified this house, that my name may be there for ever: and mine eyes and mine heart shall be there perpetually.
verses.ct: "I have now chosen and set apart this temple so that my name will remain here forever. My eyes and my heart will always be here."

verses.kjv: And as for thee, if thou wilt walk before me, as David thy father walked, and do according to all that I have commanded thee, and shalt observe my statutes and my judgments;
verses.ct: "As for you, if you live in my presence the way your father David did, doing everything I have commanded you and keeping my laws and regulations —"

verses.kjv: Then will I stablish the throne of thy kingdom, according as I have covenanted with David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man to be ruler in Israel.
verses.ct: "then I will establish your royal throne, just as I promised in my covenant with your father David when I said, 'You will never lack a descendant to rule over Israel.'"

verses.kjv: But if ye turn away, and forsake my statutes and my commandments, which I have set before you, and shall go and serve other gods, and worship them;
verses.ct: "But if you turn away and abandon the laws and commands that I have given you, and go off to serve and worship other gods —"

verses.kjv: Then will I pluck them up by the roots out of my land which I have given them; and this house, which I have sanctified for my name, will I cast out of my sight, and will make it to be a proverb and a byword among all nations.
verses.ct: "then I will uproot my people from the land I gave them. And this temple that I have set apart for my name, I will reject and turn it into an object of ridicule and mockery among every nation."

verses.kjv: And this house, which is high, shall be an astonishment to every one that passeth by it; so that he shall say, Why hath the LORD done thus unto this land, and unto this house?
verses.ct: "This temple, as impressive as it is, will shock everyone who passes by it. They will ask, 'Why has the LORD done this to this land and to this temple?'"

verses.kjv: And it shall be answered, Because they forsook the LORD God of their fathers, which brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, and laid hold on other gods, and worshipped them, and served them: therefore hath he brought all this evil upon them.
verses.ct: "And the answer will be: 'Because they abandoned the LORD, the God of their ancestors, who brought them out of Egypt. They embraced other gods, worshiped them, and served them. That is why he brought all this disaster on them.'"
